bust.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I bust my watch this morning.
bust.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if the police bust someone, they charge them with a crime
bust.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He was busted by US inspectors at the border.
bust.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if the police bust a place, they go into it to look for something illegal
bust.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Federal agents busted several money-exchange businesses.
bust.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to use too much money, so that a business etc must stop operating
bust.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The trip to Spain will probably bust our budget.
bust.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to give someone a lower military rank as a punishment
bust.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a model of someone’s head, shoulders, and upper chest, usually made of stone or metal
bust.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a woman’s breasts, or the part of her clothes that covers her breasts
bust.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a measurement around a woman’s breast and back
bust.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a situation in which the police go into a place in order to catch people doing something illegal
bust.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: if a business goes bust, it cannot continue to operate because it does not have enough money to pay its debts
bust.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The company eventually went bust, leaving debts of £7 million.
